full_summary:
# Tender Opportunity: Construction of Access Roads and Parking Lots, Forillon National Park

## General Information

* Contract Reference: cb-7111-77995087
* Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0114/A
* Tender Closing Date: August 8, 2023, 2:00 p.m.
* Expected Contract Start Date: August 22, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: October 31, 2023

## Project Overview

Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to submit a bid for the construction of access roads and parking lots at Forillon National Park. The project aims to facilitate access to restored heritage buildings and provide parking facilities for tourists.

## Requirements

The contractor will be responsible for designing and constructing the access roads and parking lots, including:

* Land clearing and excavation
* Road construction with environmental protection measures
* Provision of traffic and signage management
* Restoration of impacted areas
* Compliance with applicable federal and provincial regulations

## Evaluation Criteria

Bids will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical capability
* Financial capacity
* Past experience with similar projects

## Submissions and Contact Information

* Submissions must be made through the Government of Canada's tendering service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca)
* Bidders must submit their bid in two stages:
	1. A qualification stage, where the bidder's technical and financial capabilities will be evaluated
	2. A financial evaluation stage, where the bidder's written financial offer will be reviewed

## Enquiries and Contact Information

* All enquiries regarding the tender opportunity must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority
* Contact Information:
	+ Cloë Pelland Tessier, Contracting Authority
	+ Email: [cloe.pelland-tessier@pc.gc.ca](mailto:cloe.pelland-tessier@pc.gc.ca)
	+ Phone: (418) 928-7252
	+ Fax: 1-855-983-1808

Note: The rewritten entry has been condensed to fit within the 400-word limit and has been rephrased to improve clarity and professionalism. The original text has been modified to ensure that all relevant information is included while avoiding excessive detail. The rewritten entry includes all the necessary details for bidders to respond to the tender opportunity.
